title: EVCIM
text: We started by recovering recycled metal from abandoned mattresses. The springs were heated to straighten them and then cut using a plier. This metal was mixed with concrete to create our homemade weight plates.

title: EVCIM
text: We started by recovering recycled metal from abandoned mattresses. The springs were heated to straighten them and then cut using a plier. This metal was mixed with concrete to create our homemade weight plates.

title: EVCIM
text:
Painting the Weights
  

Once the concrete dried, the plates were coated in matte black paint. At this stage, we finalized the 5kg weight plate design. However, we could only produce six at a time.

title: EVCIM
text:
Our Finished Product
  

The result: clean, consistent 5kg concrete weights reinforced with metal. A major milestone, but we werenâ€™t done yet.

title: EVCIM
text:
Experimenting with Moulds
  

To scale up, we began developing a more consistent mould using recycled plastics. The aim was to perfect a system that would always produce identical weights at a more frequent rate.

title: EVCIM
text:
Drying Rack Innovation
  

We repurposed discarded wooden planks to build a drying rack. This allowed us to cure multiple weights simultaneously and improve our workflow.

title: EVCIM
text:
Behind the Process

  Your browser does not support the video tag. 

This clip shows part of our early-stage process: heating and bending metal taken from mattress springs â€” a key reinforcement element in the final weight.

title: EVCIM
text:
Transport Tactics
  

You might be wondering how we brought the mattresses homeâ€¦ This is how. Do not try this at home â€” unless youâ€™re feeling lucky and you have a very good excuse to the guards.

title: EVCIM
text:
Reflection

At the core of the EVCIM project is a belief that fitness should be accessible to everyone. Gym equipment, especially weights, can be expensive â€” but through recycling, creativity, and sheer trial-and-error, weâ€™ve managed to design affordable, functional weights from materials that wouldâ€™ve ended up in landfills.


Weâ€™re not just making plates â€” weâ€™re building a movement where passion meets sustainability. And weâ€™re not stopping until everyone can train, lift, and grow without breaking the bank.If you want to check out our instgarm click on the icon below.

title: Laeeqâ€™s Cricketing Journey
text:
Since I can remember, Iâ€™ve always loved cricket â€” itâ€™s been a way of life for me. It allowed me to express myself, stay active, and build lifelong friendships. Every summer as a kid, whether in Ireland or visiting Pakistan, Iâ€™d spend hours playing cricket, often with family and friends.
Cricket was never just a game â€” it was a dream. But dreams require hard work. Over the past year, Iâ€™ve taken that seriously: analyzing my technique, reviewing my match performances, and breaking down what I need to improve â€” both mentally and physically.

title: Laeeqâ€™s Cricketing Journey
text:
Performance Metrics & Stats
Over the last two seasons, Iâ€™ve played for Carlow (2023) and then moved to North County (2024). I moved to experience a higher level of cricket. Here are some stats and breakdowns of my performance â€” from batting scores to wicket-taking form.


North County (2024â€“2024)









Carlow (2023)







The move from Carlow to North County was a much-needed change. North Countyâ€™s ground (The Inch) provided a far better playing environment, and I got the opportunity to compete at a higher level â€” going from Division 16 in Carlow to regularly playing Division 4 at North County.
This 12-division jump in just one year reflects the hard work and dedication Iâ€™ve put in, and it continues to motivate me. My total runs increased from 267 in 2023 to 567 in 2024, and my average also improved significantly â€” all while playing at a higher level.
The pie charts played a huge role in helping me understand how I was getting out. For example, frequent LBWs helped me realize that my head was falling across the stumps, making me unbalanced. By identifying these patterns, I was able to make technical corrections and improve my consistency.
I still have a long way to go, but the data has given me the clarity and confidence that Iâ€™m moving in the right direction.

title: Laeeqâ€™s Cricketing Journey
text:
Reflection
Each year of cricket has taught me something new. Iâ€™ve used coding to visualize performance trends and stats, helping me identify weaknesses and build confidence. This is just the beginning of my journey.
Stay tuned â€” this is only the start.
